baseline: However, only the parents mental_health symptoms (i.e., depression symptoms) made a unique contribution to the variance in youth BMI.
high_intensity: However, only the parents' severe mental_health symptoms (i.e., deep depression symptoms) made a unique contribution to the variance in youth BMI.
low_intensity: However, only the parents' mild mental_health symptoms (i.e., slight depression symptoms) made a unique contribution to the variance in youth BMI.

baseline: Nevertheless, there is evidence that a range of interventions can improve mental_health literacy, including whole-of-community campaigns, interventions in educational settings, Mental Health First Aid training, and information websites.
high_intensity: Nevertheless, there is compelling evidence that a wide range of interventions can significantly improve mental_health literacy, including intensive whole-of-community campaigns, robust interventions in educational settings, comprehensive Mental Health First Aid training, and detailed information websites.
low_intensity: Nevertheless, there is some evidence that a limited range of interventions can slightly improve mental_health literacy, including basic community campaigns, minor interventions in educational settings, introductory Mental Health First Aid training, and simple information websites.

baseline: However, adverse experiences may also foster subsequent resilience, with resulting advantages for mental_health and well-being.
high_intensity: However, severe adverse experiences may also foster subsequent resilience, with resulting significant advantages for mental_health and well-being.
low_intensity: However, mild adverse experiences may also foster subsequent resilience, with resulting minor advantages for mental_health and well-being.

baseline: Clinicians with early childhood training and psychologists who participated in the program improvement were found to provide more appropriate referrals, and referrals led to high rates of mental_health service delivery.
high_intensity: Clinicians with intense early childhood training and psychologists who participated in the program improvement were found to provide more appropriate referrals, and referrals led to exceptionally high rates of mental_health service delivery.
low_intensity: Clinicians with some early childhood training and psychologists who participated in the program improvement were found to provide more appropriate referrals, and referrals led to moderate rates of mental_health service delivery.

baseline: Our findings underline the importance of paying considerable attention to (severe) loneliness in older adults with depressive symptoms given its high prevalence and serious mental_health consequences.
high_intensity: Our findings underline the importance of paying critical attention to (severe) loneliness in older adults with depressive symptoms given its overwhelming prevalence and dire mental_health consequences.
low_intensity: Our findings underline the importance of paying moderate attention to (severe) loneliness in older adults with depressive symptoms given its notable prevalence and significant mental_health consequences.

baseline: Findings delineate the key dimensions of mental_health caregiving and show the differential links between caregiving activities and caregiving parameters and carer adjustment.
high_intensity: Findings delineate the key dimensions of intense mental_health caregiving and show the significant differential links between demanding caregiving activities and caregiving parameters and carer emotional adjustment.
low_intensity: Findings outline the basic dimensions of basic mental_health caregiving and show the slight differential links between caregiving activities and caregiving parameters and carer adjustment.

baseline: In this article, the authors describe how spirituality is associated with cultural values, mental_health, coping strategies, and adjustment among culturally diverse youth.
high_intensity: In this article, the authors describe how spirituality is profoundly associated with intense cultural values, mental_health struggles, coping strategies, and adjustment challenges among culturally diverse youth.
low_intensity:
In this article, the authors describe how spirituality is somewhat associated with general cultural values, mental_health aspects, coping strategies, and adjustment among culturally diverse youth.
</decreased mental_health_intensity>

baseline: Expressive suppression was correlated positively with positive indicators of mental_health within the category of samples with Western cultural values (r = -.11) but not the category with Eastern cultural values.
high_intensity: Expressive suppression was correlated positively with extreme positive indicators of mental_health within the category of samples with Western cultural values (r = -.11) but not the category with Eastern cultural values.
low_intensity: Expressive suppression was correlated positively with slight positive indicators of mental_health within the category of samples with Western cultural values (r = -.11) but not the category with Eastern cultural values.

baseline: In this Norwegian sample of children, family economy was a significant predictor of mental_health problems as measured across a wide range of symptom dimensions and poor economy predicted a high probability of a psychiatric disorder.
high_intensity: In this Norwegian sample of children, family economy was a critical predictor of severe mental_health problems as measured across a broad spectrum of symptom dimensions, and poor economy predicted an extreme probability of a psychiatric disorder.
low_intensity: In this Norwegian sample of children, family economy was a notable predictor of minor mental_health problems as measured across various symptom dimensions, and poor economy predicted a moderate probability of a psychiatric disorder.

baseline: The present study tested the independent mediating effects of parent mental_health and household socioeconomic status on the associations between parental experiences of discrimination (past-year perceived discrimination and perceptions of being unaccepted culturally) and child mental_health (internalizing and externalizing symptoms) using a bootstrapping analytic approach.
high_intensity: The present study tested the independent mediating effects of severe parent mental_health and dire household socioeconomic status on the associations between parental experiences of harsh discrimination (past-year perceived discrimination and perceptions of being intensely unaccepted culturally) and profound child mental_health (pronounced internalizing and externalizing symptoms) using a bootstrapping analytic approach.
low_intensity: The present study tested the independent mediating effects of gentle parent mental_health and modest household socioeconomic status on the associations between parental experiences of subtle discrimination (past-year perceived discrimination and perceptions of being mildly unaccepted culturally) and manageable child mental_health (internalizing and externalizing symptoms) using a bootstrapping analytic approach.
